Evolution Funding

EVOGO

One of my favourite projects at Evolution Funding has been the redesign of the EVOGO website.

I was involved at all stages of this project, from mapping out the initial journeys and sitemap alongside stakeholders, to working closely with designers to translate these into effective, user centred designs.

Next, these designs were translated into a single page application using Vue, Vuex and Webpack to give the website a fluidity and responsiveness that would lead to increased customer conversions.

www.evogo.co.uk

Evolution Funding

EvoCSS & EvoToolkit

I created a SASS framework called EvoCSS to serve as a solid architectural foundation to build project styles. This incorporates many popular methodologies such as OOCSS, BEM & ITCSS to make the CSS scalable and maintainable.

I also created EvoToolkit, which is a user interface library for developers who require ready-made, reusable UI components which they can easily drop into their projects.

These components can be viewed at the pattern library below, which is a data-driven static site generated by Gulp and Nunjucks.

toolkit.evolution-funding.com

Evolution Funding

Mike Brewer Motors

My involvement with the redesign of the Mike Brewer Motors website ranged from being involved in early stakeholder meetings, where I helped guide the designs to improve their UX, to then developing all of its front-end codebase and Gulp-driven build system.

Once this was done, I then went on to support PHP developers as they integrated this all with back-end APIs and CRM systems to round off the project.

www.mikebrewermotors.com

Evolution Funding

Application Form A/B Test

I redesigned one of Evolution Funding’s main car credit application forms from a mobile-first perspective, as nearly 70% of traffic was coming from smaller screens, and the existing form wasn’t nearly as optimised as it could have been.

An A/B Test was then ran to record how the new form performed against the old. Overall, the new form shaved just over a minute off the average completion time and conversion was increased by nearly 25%. A big win.

This is the online portfolio of Luke Harrison - a Sheffield based web designer & front-end developer.
